author: CyberQP
title: CyberQP Releases Groundbreaking Zero Trust Helpdesk Security Platform to Eliminate Standing Privileges
text:
CyberQP Releases Groundbreaking Zero Trust Helpdesk Security Platform to Eliminate Standing Privileges By: CyberQP via Business Wire April 02, 2025 at 17:30 PM EDT CyberQP, a leading provider of access management solutions, has launched its Zero Trust Helpdesk Security Platform‚Äîcombining QGuard for Privileged Access Management (PAM) and QDesk for End-User Access Management (EUAM). This unified solution helps IT teams reduce risk, improve efficiency, and eliminate standing privileges across the organization.
Game-Changing Access Control
A key innovation of the platform is End-User Elevation , which allows users to gain temporary admin access without persistent privileges. By automating approval processes and monitoring activity in real-time, CyberQP dramatically reduces attack surfaces while maintaining security and compliance.
‚ÄúWe built this platform to address major security gaps caused by always-on access,‚Äù said Mateo Barraza, CEO & Co-Founder of CyberQP. ‚ÄúWith QGuard and QDesk, businesses can finally enforce true Zero Trust principles across their environments.‚Äù
Platform Highlights
Just-in-Time Access: Grant technicians and users time-limited access only when needed‚Äîno standing privileges, no exposed passwords. Credential Rotation: Automatically rotate credentials to prevent stale logins and reduce vulnerability to attacks. Self-Service Tools: End users can reset passwords and manage accounts without technician intervention, cutting down ticket volume and costs. Helpdesk Verification: Instantly verify user identities to prevent social engineering and fraud. Comprehensive Visibility: A unified dashboard delivers insights across privileged and end-user access activity. CyberQP integrates with PSA platforms including ConnectWise, Datto Autotask, and Halo PSA, and meets key compliance and cyber insurance requirements with SOC 2 Type 2 certification.
Availability
The CyberQP Zero Trust Helpdesk Security Platform is available now. For more information or to request a demo, visit www.cyberqp.com .
About CyberQP
CyberQP simplifies access management by eliminating standing privileges and enabling secure, efficient workflows for IT teams. With a mission to ‚ÄúEmpower Access, Redefine Privilege,‚Äù CyberQP helps organizations stay protected, compliant, and productive.
View source version on businesswire.com: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250331851727/en/

author: archyde
title: App State Football Signs Nine Players for 2025 Class
text:
App State Football Inks Nine for Class of 2025 BOONE, N.C. App State Football bolstered its future, signing nine talented prospects from across the country. The class, rated as three-stars, showcases a balance of youthful talent on both sides of the ball.
Defensive Depth Added
Headlining the class is defensive lineman Kaden Ellis. From Canton, Georgia, Ellis brings size (6‚Äô1‚Äù, 280) and proven production (56 tackles, 14 tackles for loss as a sophomore).

Three other defensive standouts highlight the class.

The defensive line received a boost with the addition of Caleb Pitts from Auburn, Alabama.
Energizing the Offense
Dillon Galloway, a tight end from Rosman, North Carolina, brings impressive size (6‚Äô4‚Äù, 215) and a knack for making big plays.
"We‚Äôre excited to have Dillon join our program, " said head coach Butch Davis. "He‚Äôs a strong, athletic tight end who we believe will make an impact. "
Kaelin Shaw, a versatile athlete from Wichita Hes.

author: V.G.
title: √âtats-Unis: le nombre d'avortements en hausse malgr√© les restrictions du droit √† l'IVG depuis 2022
text:
Selon le Planning familial, il y a eu pr√®s de 100.000 avortements aux √âtats-Unis en moyenne chaque mois au premier trimestre 2024, un chiffre plus √©lev√© qu'en 2022 et 2023. Le nombre d'avortements aux Etats-Unis a augment√© depuis que la Cour Supr√™me a supprim√© en 2022 la garantie f√©d√©rale du droit √† l'interruption volontaire de grossesse, permettant √† 22 √âtats de mettre en place des restrictions l√©gales, selon une √©tude publi√©e mercredi.
D'apr√®s la Society of Family Planning (SFP), qui milite pour l'acc√®s aux droits reproductifs, il y a eu 98.990 avortements par mois en moyenne au premier trimestre 2024, un chiffre plus √©lev√© qu'en 2022 et 2023.
Cette organisation attribue une bonne part de cette augmentation aux pilules abortives obtenues via des consultations √† distance. La proportion d'avortements r√©alis√©s par ce biais est pass√©e de 4 √† 20 % au niveau national depuis 2022.
En juin 2022, la majorit√© conservatrice √† la Cour Supr√™me, issue des r√©centes nominations de l'ancien pr√©sident r√©publicain Donald Trump, avait mis fin √† la protection f√©d√©rale du droit √† l'avortement, ouvrant la voie √† l'adoption de l√©gislations tr√®s restrictives, allant jusqu'√† l'interdiction totale, dans nombre d'√âtats conservateurs .
Des baisses importantes au Texas ou en G√©orgie Mais des Etats dirig√©s par les d√©mocrates avaient au contraire d√©cid√© de mettre en place des "lois boucliers" permettant de prot√©ger les docteurs pratiquant des consultations √† distance au b√©n√©fice de patientes dans les √âtats vis√©s par une interdiction.
Selon la SFP, 9.200 avortements ont en moyenne √©t√© r√©alis√©es sous la protection de ces lois entre janvier et mars 2024, soit une hausse de 16% par rapport au trimestre pr√©c√©dent.
L'√©tude du Planning familial montre par ailleurs des baisses significatives du nombre d'avortements dans des √âtats ayant vot√© des restrictions ou des interdictions depuis 2022, les plus importantes √©tant au Texas, en G√©orgie, au Tennessee, en Louisiane et en Alabama.
Le droit √† l'avortement, et les droits reproductifs en g√©n√©ral, seront un des principaux sujets de la campagne pr√©sidentielle am√©ricaine, la candidate d√©mocrate Kamala Harris s'√©tant engag√©e √† r√©installer une protection au niveau f√©d√©ral si elle √©tait √©lue .
Sur le m√™me sujet Aux √âtats-Unis, les interdictions de l'avortement affectent les soins pour femmes enceintes √âtats-Unis: la gouverneure d'Arizona abroge la loi de 1864 interdisant l'avortement Elle critique r√©guli√®rement son rival r√©publicain Donald Trump pour le r√¥le qu'il a jou√© en nommant trois juges conservateurs √† la Cour supr√™me avant qu'elle ne prenne sa d√©cision de 2022.

title: Lyon. Ces climatiseurs vrombissent jour et nuit √† leur fen√™tre : ¬´ Cinq ans que √ßa dure, c'est ...
text:
Lyon Ces climatiseurs vrombissent jour et nuit √† leur fen√™tre : ¬´ Cinq ans que √ßa dure, c‚Äôest infernal ! ¬ª
¬´ On ne veut pas passer un √©t√© de plus sans pouvoir ouvrir les fen√™tres, ni dormir la nuit. ¬ª Pour Claudette Bedu, habitante du dernier √©tage du 6, rue Victor-Hugo, et sa fille Isabelle, la coupe est pleine. Voil√† bient√¥t cinq ans que ces deux femmes (et leurs voisins) subissent, de jour comme de nuit, le ¬´ vrombissement permanent ¬ª d‚Äôun bloc de climatisation install√© de l‚Äôautre c√¥t√© de la voie, sur le toit du 3, rue Victor-Hugo, dans le 2e arrondissement de Lyon.
¬´ Cela fait perdre de la valeur √† nos appartements ! ¬ª
Une unit√© jumelle, implant√©e juste au-dessus du 4, rue Auguste-Comte, dans le m√™me p√¢t√© de maisons, provoque des d√©sagr√©ments sonores similaires. ¬´ En plus des nuisances, c‚Äôest non seulement inesth√©tique, mais cela fait perdre de la valeur √† nos appartements ! ¬ª, affirmait peu apr√®s la double mise en marche, Nicole Peloux, r√©sidente du 5, rue Auguste-Comte.
Ces deux dispositifs, ¬´ tr√®s bruyants ¬ª, ont √©t√© install√©s...

author: Steve Easton
title: 4 on Men's Golf Named to Academic All-MAC Team | UToledo News
text:
The University of Toledo men‚Äôs golf program placed four student-athletes on the Academic All-MAC team, the league office recently announced. The Rockets‚Äô four honorees mark the seventh-straight season that four or more Toledo golfers have been honored.
Senior Jamie Butler, senior CJ van Wyk, junior Mads Jensen and sophomore Mason Deal were each honored for the first time. All four Rockets possess a grade point average of 3.7 or higher. Butler is leading the Rockets with a 3.949 grade point average, while Deal possesses a 3.911 mark.
The Academic All-MAC honor is for a student-athlete who has excelled in athletics and academics. To qualify, a student-athlete must have at least a 3.20 cumulative GPA and have participated in at least 50 percent of the contests for that particular sport. First-year students and transfers in their first year of residence are not eligible for the award.

author: Admin
title: Prestigious European grant for research into biodegradable plastics
text:
Professor dr. Linda Amaral-Zettler, Research Leader at NIOZ Royal Netherlands Institute of Sea Research and the Chair in Marine Microbiology at the University of Amsterdam has been awarded a prestigious Advanced ERC-grant by the European Commission today. Amaral-Zettler receives almost 3,5 million euros for her research into biodegradation in the marine environment. ‚ÄúBiodegradable sounds really nice‚Äù, she admits. ‚ÄúBut before we repeat the mistakes we‚Äôve made with fossil-fuel-based plastics back in the last millenium, we really want to understand how these materials interact with marine life and how long they last in the environment.‚Äù ‚ÄúBiodegradable sounds really nice‚Äù, she admits. ‚ÄúBut before we repeat the mistakes we‚Äôve made with fossil-fuel-based plastics back in the last millenium, we really want to understand how these materials interact with marine life and how long they last in the environment.‚Äù
Credit: NIOZ/Anneke Hymmen
Professor dr. Linda Amaral-Zettler, Research Leader at NIOZ Royal Netherlands Institute of Sea Research and the Chair in Marine Microbiology at the University of Amsterdam has been awarded a prestigious Advanced ERC-grant by the European Commission today. Amaral-Zettler receives almost 3,5 million euros for her research into biodegradation in the marine environment. ‚ÄúBiodegradable sounds really nice‚Äù, she admits. ‚ÄúBut before we repeat the mistakes we‚Äôve made with fossil-fuel-based plastics back in the last millenium, we really want to understand how these materials interact with marine life and how long they last in the environment.‚Äù ‚ÄúBiodegradable sounds really nice‚Äù, she admits. ‚ÄúBut before we repeat the mistakes we‚Äôve made with fossil-fuel-based plastics back in the last millenium, we really want to understand how these materials interact with marine life and how long they last in the environment.‚Äù
Vibrant sea
For the next five years, Amaral-Zettler, together with three PhD-candidates and lab analysts, will work on the project she creatively calls ‚ÄòViBRANT-SEA‚Äô, the acronym for her project entitled: Validating Biodegradation Rates and Reactions Applying Novel Technologies and Systems Ecology Approaches . ‚ÄúAbove all, with this project we want to emphasize how vibrant the marine ecosystem still is and how we should keep it that way.‚Äù
Who biodegrades the biodegradables?
The project is divided in three so-called work-packages. ‚ÄúIn the first, we want to identify who is breaking down the biodegradables. We will look for novel microbes, but also for specific genes in these microbes, that encode the enzymes that are necessary for biodegradation of the main components of two biodegradable polymers we will concentrate on: polyhydroxyalkanoates and polylactic acid. In the meantime, we may also find pathways that produce these polymers, because many microbes that break down biodegradable plastics, are also able to produce them‚Äù, Amaral-Zettler explains.
How fast do they break down?
In a second work-package, Amaral-Zettler and her team hope to find out how fast ‚Äì or how slow ‚Äì the biodegradable plastics break down into carbon dioxide, water and biomass. ‚ÄúWe will establish that both in the lab, as well as under field conditions, using plastic with labeled carbon. Biodegradation under the high pressures and low temperatures of the deep sea, may be something entirely different than under conditions on land. And unfortunately, much of our plastics end up in the deep sea.‚Äù
Without lab animals
In a third work-package, Amaral-Zettler intends to collaborate with Bart Spee, expert at so-called organoids at Utrecht University, to design an organoid, or an artificial organ of a marine fish in a petri dish. ‚ÄúAt the moment, the mandatory testing of ecotoxicity of new plastic materials is only ‚Äòoptional‚Äô in fish, because the testing in these animals is complex and considered ethically problematic. However, fish are very important potential victims of the plastics that end up in the sea. Therefore, we hope to come up with an alternative, animal-free method to test this toxicity. We hope to test the toxicity of both conventional and biodegradable plastics, as well as their additives, such as colorants or PFAS that are added to these materials.‚Äù
Avoid the trap
Amaral-Zettler is very grateful to the European Commission for the opportunities that this ERC-grant provides. ‚ÄúTo date, biodegradable plastics represent a small fraction of the total amount of plastics we produce, but this is increasing each year. And we really want to avoid stepping into the same trap as we did back in the fifties, when we thought plastic was a ‚Äònice and durable‚Äô material that could do no harm. This ERC-grant gives us the opportunity to predict the lifetimes and impacts of biodegradable plastics, a step towards understanding how these new plastics behave in the marine environment. I hope the results of this project help manufacturers produce more environmentally friendly products, help legislators draft policies based on science, and consumers make intelligent choices when shopping. That‚Äôs what we need to maintain our vibrant seas!‚Äù

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: Customer's photo of forlorn owner in empty restaurant leads business to boom at OK diner Nick Chappell had never been to Spirals Hot Dogs & More before he took a photo of Scott Hosek in his empty restaurant. But after business boomed, Chappell's part of the Spirals family, Hosek says. [Anthony Robledo](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7612431001/anthony-robledo/) An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for. During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Hosek standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Hosek would soon have no time to stand around as " [Spirals: Hot Dogs & More](https://spiralshotdogs.com/)," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral. "We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Hosek told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me." The day the photo was taken, Hosek found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Hosek said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down. Hosek wouldn't hear of it. "You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': [See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her](/story/life/humankind/2023/12/26/dolly-parton-meets-longtime-fan/72033945007/) Customer knew he had to capture 'wholesome moment' Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance. Noticing Hosek gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in." "A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said. In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Hosek waiting for diners. Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit. "I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post." Owner adds new 'Thunderbird' item in customer's honor Hosek is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so. The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalape√±os, Hosek said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of. The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact. Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family. "To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesn‚Äôt have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Hosek added.
